review_title: Special Ed Teacher @ East Mountain School
job_title: Special Executive Director Teacher in Belle Mead, NJ
pros: Compensation package was good. Management treated me well and was laissez-faire. Heath benefits are great provided you visit HMH medical offices. Good work culture for the most part. I enjoyed my role as a special ed teacher there and was able to make a difference in many students lives.
cons:
A challenge to recruit and retain special ed teachers with the proper certifications & experience to handle students with severe behavioral and emotional disabilities.  

Very cliquey & assertive staff who have way too much influence on administrative decisions; including an arrogant, wannabe supervisor with a limited skills who likes to showcase his minor league leadership abilities. 

Lack of modern educational resources,  a deteriorating building, tiny classrooms, no social-emotional learning curriculum or even a breakfast program to feed students in the morning. 

Contractual breach when I submitted my resignation. (They cancelled my heath coverage immediately instead of honoring the 30 day clause in my contract.) No acknowledgement or well-wishes from anyone in HR or Leadership when I resigned.

review_title: Has gone downhill in recent years
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Belle Mead, NJ
pros: The work itself is rewarding. Having the opportunity to help people who are in tough seasons of their lives is a great experience. I have developed a much more rounded worldview since starting this job and have been able to apply the compassion and patience I have gained to my everyday life. There is nothing better than seeing the growth of a patient from their admission to their discharge date. Lives are changed here!
cons: The administration seems to care less and less about staff and patients as time goes on. We are incredibly understaffed, likely due to low pay relative to the work we do and difficulty working with upper management. It seems that the merge with Hackensack took a lot of culture out of the hospital and providing the most quality care for our patients seems to no longer be the top priority.

review_title: hell on earth - Stay away at all costs
job_title: MHT in Belle Mead, NJ
pros: There is not a single pro of working here - I legitimately cannot think of a single good thing about this place.
cons: Carrier treats its nurses and techs like cattle. Chronically short staffed in a way that creates a dangerous environment for staff and patients alike. The short staffing must be emphasized - it is extreme and inexcusable. Extremely high patient acuity, low starting pay. Dismal COVID-19 response. Management is absent and uncaring, only concerned with money. Staff on the floor are drowning. I seriously contemplated suicide working here due to stress from this job. Morale is non-existent - staff routinely joke about wanting to commit suicide. I could go on and on.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Belle Mead, NJ

review_title: A great start for anyone interested in mental health; highly ethical coworkers
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Belle Mead, NJ
pros:
Most coworkers have a strong moral compass and care about the patients, and most are hardworking enough to keep things flowing smoothly.   While I do think there is lots of room for improvement, I'd be able to rest peacefully if someone I cared about was admitted here.  Just because of the people who work here,  I felt compelled to review this place and give it 4.5 stars.

If you like this kind of work, you will have an opportunity to make impacts on people's lives.

Tuition reimbursement and opportunity for mobility between departments and units.

Lots of opportunity for PTO, extra shifts, etc.  All the usual benefits of unionized hospitals.
cons:
No major complains but-

I wish greater precautions were taken with certain patients that the hospital is ill-equipped to handle, or perhaps they were just not admitted at all.  It's the mental health techs and nurses that put themselves at risk.

Cell phone policy is archaic, especially for nightshift;  phones help employees stay awake.

review_title: As a Behavioral Health provider it fosters open discussion and exchange of ideas from all staff

review_title: Great first job in psychiatric setting
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Belle Mead, NJ

job_title: Residential Counselor in Bloomfield, NJ
pros: Hands-on experience.  Helpful co-workers.  Available overtime.  Carrier is a good place to start to help you decide if you want to pursue a career in behavioral or mental health.
cons: Pressure to work overtime if available.  No public transportation to the facility.  The industry does not pay its hands-on workers enough.

job_title: MHT in Belle Mead, NJ
pros: Supportive environment for staff members. Tuition reimbursement for Healthcare related degrees is really great, and they are understanding about working around unpredictable class schedules. The pay is higher here than most psychiatric hospitals.
cons: Really difficult field to be in. Mental health doesn't pay very well, especially on the entry level and the level of burnout is high.
